instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hello guys

have one query related MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> gets stuck on the Apple logo as soon as it starts up. In this condition, if I press the power key for 4-5 times continuous ,the MacBook starts up and then works fine. Macbook was working earlier but after resetting it came in this condition.tried resetting several times.

any suggestion

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

What kind of reset do you mean, SMC reset, PRAM?

You should discard a software issue first.
Save data and install new macOS.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
this problem happens while installing the new macOS....

i already tried to re install the macOS but problem is same....

<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>    3.295V is present
F/L4800     7.65 is present

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
By resetting, do you mean new installation tried?
Try known good BIOS...

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Yes new installation of macOS

Before installing fresh MacOS, macbook was working good but after installation
macbook gets stuck on the Apple logo as soon as it starts up. In this condition, if I press the power key for 4-5 times continuous ,the MacBook starts up and then works fine.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Then the BIOS is first suspect...

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Is there is any different process to read & write bios data for this macbook or
I have same model donor board, can I directly transfer the bios chip to faulty macbook

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
You can transfer the chip for test.
But it has dirty ME region for the other board.
And this may cause strange issues; not a good option for this case.

Being BGA chip, I recommend you to write clean ME BIOS directly; avoid repeatedly solder/unsolder process.
You will need correct adapter for that chip.
